p.s: Starr finds herself in a demonstration protesting against police brutality and against the police officer who shot Khalil.
The situation is especially hard for Starr because the place this demonstration is carried out at is the first time she visits it after Khalil's killing.
In the demonstration itself there is a large crowd of people holding up black hair brusheshairbrushes.
The reason for this is because the officer who shot Khalil said that he had mistaken Khalil's hairbrush with a gun which is why he shot him.
The crowd is chanting the phrase A hairbrush is not a gun (l. 8).
When Starr arrives at the place she finds her attorney Ms. Ofrah standing on top of a police car with a bullhorn.
When Ms. Ofrah noticed Starr she went up to her and Starr explained how she wanted to do something now.
Ultimately leading up to her being given the bullhorn and telling her point of view of the killing and making clear that Khalil was a decent human being and not a gang member.
With taht introduction she then starts chanting Khalil lived.
The fans gave her a rapturous round of applause which encouraged her to speak even more.
Starr arrived at the demonstration together with Seven, her half brotherhalf-brother, Devante and Chris, her boyfriend.
Even though she wasn't much into taking action she decided she wants to after hearing that the officer, who shot Khalil was considered unguilty by the court and the charges on him were dropped.
